intro: Armeniaca vulgaris var. amarella, commonly known as the sweet cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southwest Asia. It produces small, oval leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant flowers with white to pink blossoms in early spring, followed by the development of sweet, fleshy fruits. The fruits, known as cherries, are typically red or yellow when ripe and contain a single hard pit. This variety is widely cultivated for its flavorful fruit and ornamental value.
